III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding considering the need for maintaining
the agency license due to the agency not currently performing any functions
requiring a Child Placing Agency license.
• The agency will need to obtain MiSACWIS and CWLM access if the plan
is to maintain a license. None of the agency staff currently have access to either
system as it is not used at least once a year as is required to maintain access.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no substantiated incidents of corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted no corrective action plans (CAP) during this licensing
period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment completed 2/19/2025 was reviewed and
discussed. The Chief Administrator identified full compliance with licensing rules.
The agency currently has no licensed foster homes or foster care cases and has
not had any over the period under review. The Chief Administrator reported foster
home recruitment continues to be a challenge due the population served by the
agency.
2

The agency has not had any open foster homes and has not placed any youths in
foster care over the past three review periods. The licensing supervisor reported
they are not actively recruiting foster homes. It was recommended the agency staff
discuss the need for continuing to maintain a child placing agency license if there
are no plans to perform any functions for which the agency is licensed.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
The foster care and foster home licensing worker and supervisor were interviewed
during the on-site inspection. They have not performed any foster care or foster
home functions during the period under review. They are not currently actively
recruiting foster homes.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office is located within the county court building. There is adequate
space and equipment to perform the functions of foster home certification and
placement of youths in foster homes. The physical CHRI of three foster homes
closed over a year ago continue to be stored in a locked file cabinet within the
foster care/licensing supervisor's office
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
N/A
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
